special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
After a standard system update you need to reboot your computer to make
all the necessary changes.
threat: A local attacker might exploit this flaw to escalate privilege, if access to /dev/cuse has been modified to allow non-root users.
Changes made by an attacker might not be discovered by IMA, if SELinux was disabled, and a new IMA rule was loaded.
A local attacker on non-x86 systems might be able to cause a denial of service.
A local attacker could exploit this flaw to cause a denial of service or gain root privileges.
